Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TicTacToeHashCode

    abstract class Board
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The superclass used for TicTacToeHashCode. This class primarily contains the graphical elements used in TicTacToeHashCode, which is why it extends JFrame. The frame created contains nine buttons representing the nine spots on a TicTacToe board and has labels with the hash code and whether or not this class is a winner. This class has abstract methods because the methods related to hashing and determining the win are supposed to be defined in TicTacToeHashCode. This class was written by my instructor to be used in the assignment.
    Author:
    Mrs. Kelly

    • Method Detail

      • setHashCodeLabel

        public void setHashCodeLabel​(int hashcode)
        Sets the label for the hashcode using a passed in String. Does not calculate the hash code itself.
        Parameters:
        hashcode - a given integer that is supposed to be the hash code

      • setWinnerLabel

        public void setWinnerLabel​(java.lang.String result)
        Sets the label for the winner using a passed in String. Does not determine the winner itself.
        Parameters:
        result - a given String that is supposed to represent whether the boardString is a winner or a loser

      • setWinnerLabel

        public void setWinnerLabel​(boolean result)
        Sets the winner label using a given Boolean. This method does not calculate this status itself. If the parameter is true, the label will be set to winner. If the boolean is false, the label will be set to loser. This uses the setWinnerLabel with a String method, so it should be used instead of that other method because the label should only be set to winner or loser.
        Parameters:
        result - a boolean representing the winning status

      • actionPerformed

        Parameters:

      • setupPanelOne

        javax.swing.JPanel setupPanelOne​()
        Creates and returns a JPanel with the correct current hash code, winner label, and title of the Board. This method is used as part of the original set up, and is not used every time that something is changed on the board, meaning that the values such as hash code are not automatically re-displayed because of this method.
        Returns:
        a JPanel that will be used in the JFrame of the board

      • setupPanelTwo

        private javax.swing.JPanel setupPanelTwo​()
        Creates and returns a JPanel to be integrated into the board. This mainly sets up the button section of the board.
        Returns:
        a JPanel with buttons on it

      • cycleValue

        private static char cycleValue​(char ch)
        Used to cycle out the values of the board, by replacing certain character with other certain characters.
        Parameters:
        ch - an x, o or space character
        Returns:
        if 'x', an 'o'; if 'o', a ' '; else, 'x'

      • randomXO

        private char randomXO​()
        Returns a random option for the TicTacToe board, namely an x, an o, or a space.
        Returns:
        a random character out of the three options: an x, and o or a space

      • isWin

        abstract boolean isWin​(java.lang.String s)
        An abstract method that should return whether or not the String passed in is a winning TicTacToe String, hopefully using an array of winners and hash codes
        Parameters:
        s - the String whose winning status should be determined
        Returns:
        true, if s is a win, false otherwise

        Returns:
        true, if boardString is a win, false otherwise

        Parameters:

      • charAt

        public char charAt​(java.lang.String s,
                   int row,
                   int col)
        Returns the char in a String, which if it were a 3x3 array, would be at position [row, col]. If the length is not long enough, an * will be returned
        Parameters:
        s - the String holding the char to be found
        row - the row the char would be on
        col - the col the char would be on
        Returns:
        a char at the proper position in s, if s is not long enough, an *

      • show

        public void show​(java.lang.String s)
        Shows the TicTacToe string passed in on the buttons array. This does not change the labels which show the hash code and the winning status
        Parameters:
        s - the String to be displayed on the buttons
